revisionDesc.change: Added via github because the file was stuck in finalization in the editor.

Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - line 2 is missing, but that is not clear from the translation by Van Beek, so I would change "For the buildings" into "For the buildings [...]" line 4: mistake in translation by Bart Van Beek, should be corrected: "at the rate of 16 dr. for 10,000 bricks 16 dr." -> should become -> "at the rate of 80 dr. for 10,000 bricks: 16 dr." The edition of Van Beek uses a different layout for the translation (in columns), hence no commas or colons are used, but as the papyri.info layout is different, I would certainly add commas and colons otherwise the structure is not at all clear, that is: before each new entry better use a comma, before each amount, better use a colon, so e.g. " , for 2000 bricks used for the walls which have been built, at the rate of 80 dr. for 10,000 bricks: 16 dr., to builders and their assistants: 8 dr., " etc."

div.p: For the buildings [...] for 2000 bricks used for the walls which have been built, at the rate of 80 dr. for 10,000 bricks: 16 dr. to builders and their assistants: 8 dr. for mats used in plastering, 270 cubits at 3/4 ob.: 33 dr. 4 1/2 ob. for plastering at 4 dr. for 100 cubits: 11 dr. total: 68 dr. 4 1/2 ob. for the unfinished building (?) near the hay-loft: 2000 bricks (?) for those who dug the foundation and - - - for bricks used for the walls raised in height: 9960 bricks at a price for 10,000 bricks at 80 (dr.): 79 dr. 4 ob. Translation with slight modifications: B. Van Beek in P.Petr.Kleon, p. 252, © Peeters
